title: ICE running miri nightly

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Running `cargo miri` on a project fails:
<details>
<summary>Backtrace:</summary>

```
Hello, world!
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'cannot alloc memory for unsized type', src\librustc_mir\interpret\place.rs:942:13
stack backtrace:
   0: std::sys_common::alloc::realloc_fallback
   1: std::panicking::take_hook
   2: std::panicking::take_hook
   3: rustc::ty::structural_impls::<impl rustc::ty::context::Lift for rustc::ty::adjustment::AutoBorrow>::lift_to_tcx
   4: std::panicking::rust_panic_with_hook
   5: <unknown>
   6: <unknown>
   7: <unknown>
   8: <unknown>
   9: <unknown>
  10: rustc_interface::interface::Compiler::output_file
  11: <unknown>
  12: <unknown>
  13: rustc_driver::set_sigpipe_handler
  14: rustc_driver::set_sigpipe_handler
  15: <env_logger::filter::inner::Filter as core::fmt::Display>::fmt
  16: <rustc_driver::Compilation as core::fmt::Debug>::fmt
  17: rustc_driver::set_sigpipe_handler
  18: _rust_maybe_catch_panic
  19: rustc_driver::set_sigpipe_handler
  20: <std::error::<impl core::convert::From<alloc::string::String> for alloc::boxed::Box<dyn +std::error::Error+core::marker::Sync+core::marker::Send>>::from::StringError as core::fmt::Display>::fmt
  21: std::sys::windows::thread::Thread::new
  22: BaseThreadInitThunk
  23: RtlUserThreadStart
query stack during panic:
end of query stack

error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports

note: rustc 1.35.0-nightly (96d700f1b 2019-04-10) running on x86_64-pc-windows-msvc

note: compiler flags: -Z always-encode-mir -Z mir-emit-retag -Z mir-opt-level=0 -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type bin

note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden

error: Could not compile `miritest`.

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.
```
</details>

Rustc version: rustc 1.35.0-nightly (96d700f1b 2019-04-10)

Steps to reproduce:

```
cargo new example
cd example
cargo miri
```
